text: Paulus Henrique Benedictus "Paul" Cox (16 April 1940 - 18 June 2016) was an award-winning Dutch-born Australian filmmaker. He was known as 'Australia's most prolific film auteur'. He published Reflections: An Autobiographical Journey in 1998. Cox was born in Venlo, Limburg, the Netherlands. His movie- essay The Remarkable Mr. Kaye (2005) is a portrait of his sick friend, the actor Norman Kaye, who appeared in many of Cox movies, such as Lonely Hearts and Man of Flowers. In 2006 he became the Patron of the Byron Bay Film Festival. ==References== Category:1940 births Category:2016 deaths Category:Australian educators Category:Australian movie directors Category:Australian screenwriters Category:Cancer deaths in Australia Category:Deaths from liver cancer Category:Naturalised citizens of Australia Category:People from Venlo Category:Australian photographers Category:Writers from Limburg (Netherlands)
title: Paul Cox
